III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
The house is located in a neighborhood next to the Kalamazoo College campus.
The house is a two story wood frame home. The three bedrooms are on the second
floor and each bedroom can accommodate two youth. One bathroom is located on
the second floor and there is one bathroom on the first floor. There is a basement
that will not be used by the residents. The house was found to be in good condition
with all beds, bedding, dishes, living room and dining room furniture in place and
ready for occupancy. The house has a kitchen, dining room, living room, and an
office on the first floor. The fire and environment health inspections were completed,
both with “A” ratings.
B. Program Description
This group home is an open, step-down facility serving young men who have been in
an institutional setting, as well as young men who have not been successful in a
foster home setting. It is licensed for six boys, ages thirteen to eighteen. The young
2

men have histories of abuse, neglect, delinquency, mild to moderate mental illness
and school/home truancy. The length of stay is estimated to be six to ten months.
The program will provide the youth with various groups conducted in the home by
staff or community persons. The youth will also receive individual counseling as
needed and family counseling. The youth attend a public school in the community
and are assisted by facility staff who attend IEPs. Behavior problems in the school
are handled between facility staff and the school teachers and counselors. For older
youth who are two or more years below the expected grade level, a GED program is
developed for them. The facility staff assist youth in learning how to fill out
applications and going for interviews in order to get a job.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend the issuance of a six-month provisional license.
